title: of the Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 17) (Conditions for Receipt 
of Jobseeker’s Payments) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024. 

Commencement

title: of the Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No.
heading: 3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control)
text_raw:
3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 

Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 142 of 2007) are amended– 

(a) 

in article 44 (amended by article 2 of Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 
2) (Days not to be treated as days of unemployment) Regulations 
2024 (S.I. No. 35 of 2024)) by the insertion of the following subarticle after sub-article (3): 

“(4) 
For the purposes of Chapter 12 of Part 2, and 
notwithstanding any other provision in this article, where a 
person is entitled to jobseeker’s benefit in respect of any 
day in a payment week, and that person commences 
employment in that payment week, which results in their 
claim to jobseeker’s benefit being closed, any remaining 
days in that payment week where they would have been 
ordinarily entitled to jobseeker’s benefit but for the reason 
that they commenced employment, shall be considered to 
be a day of unemployment.”, and 

(b) 

in article 117 (amended by article 6 of the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 8th November, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [605] 3 

6) (Retained Fire Fighters) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 254 of 
2013)) by the insertion of the following sub-article after subarticle (2): 

For the purposes of Chapter 2 of Part 3, and 
“(3) 
notwithstanding any other provision in this article, where a 
person is entitled to jobseeker’s allowance in respect of any 
day in a payment week, and that person commences 
employment in that payment week, which results in their 
claim to jobseeker’s allowance being closed, any remaining 
days in that payment week where they would have been 
ordinarily entitled to jobseeker’s allowance but for the 
reason 
they commenced employment, shall be 
considered to be a day of unemployment.”. 

that 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

5 November, 2024. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [605]

title: of the Schedule to the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provides that for the week a person returns to employment, 
that person will be entitled to the full payment of Jobseeker’s Benefit or of 
Jobseeker’s Allowance for that week. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [605] 5
